DataElement.preferredName: COVID-19 Infection Psychosocial Effect Symptom Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A textual description of the physical, psychological, cognitive symptom or social consequence of the disease, including stigmatization of persons affected.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: An acute infection of the respiratory tract that is caused by the severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2). Based on currently available information, SARS-CoV-2 is thought to mainly spread from person to person through respiratory droplets. Typically, there is a two- to 14-day incubation period and infected persons can present with no symptoms or mild to severe fever, dry cough, fatigue, and difficulty breathing. Dysgeusia, anosmia, and gastrointestinal and flu-like symptoms have also been reported. Older adults and persons of any age who have serious underlying medical conditions may be of higher risk for severe illness, including secondary infections, respiratory failure, and multi-organ dysfunction._Having to do with the physical, psychological, cognitive, and social consequences of disease, including stigmatization of persons affected._Subjective evidence of disease perceived by the patient.

Based on currently available information, SARS-CoV-2 is thought to mainly spread from person to person through respiratory droplets. Typically, there is a two- to 14-day incubation period and infected persons can present with no symptoms or mild to severe fever, dry cough, fatigue, and difficulty breathing. Dysgeusia, anosmia, and gastrointestinal and flu-like symptoms have also been reported. Older adults and persons of any age who have serious underlying medical conditions may be of higher risk for severe illness, including secondary infections, respiratory failure, and multi-organ dysfunction.:Having to do with the physical, psychological, cognitive, and social consequences of disease, including stigmatization of persons affected.

Concepts.definition: An acute infection of the respiratory tract that is caused by the severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2). Based on currently available information, SARS-CoV-2 is thought to mainly spread from person to person through respiratory droplets. Typically, there is a two- to 14-day incubation period and infected persons can present with no symptoms or mild to severe fever, dry cough, fatigue, and difficulty breathing. Dysgeusia, anosmia, and gastrointestinal and flu-like symptoms have also been reported. Older adults and persons of any age who have serious underlying medical conditions may be of higher risk for severe illness, including secondary infections, respiratory failure, and multi-organ dysfunction.
Having to do with the physical, psychological, cognitive, and social consequences of disease, including stigmatization of persons affected.

Property.preferredDefinition: An indication that a person has a condition or disease.  Some examples of symptoms are headache, fever, fatigue, nausea, vomiting, and pain.

Concepts.definition: Subjective evidence of disease perceived by the patient.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 2022-2-15 ak Released per DW review. 2021-12-6 ak Created for Project 5 Tier 1.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Having to do with the physical, psychological, cognitive, and social consequences of disease, including stigmatization of persons affected._Subjective evidence of disease perceived by the patient._Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A directive to specify when the listed responses are not sufficient.

Concepts.definition: A directive to specify when the listed responses are not sufficient.

PermissibleValues.value: Feeling that they have been treated differently because of COVID-19

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that an individual feels that they have been treated differently.

Concepts.definition: A response indicating that an individual feels that they have been treated differently.

PermissibleValues.value: Comfortable with the amount of preparation for COVID-19 in their community or neighborhood by the local government

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that an individual is comfortable with the amount of preparation by the local government for their community or neighborhood.

Concepts.definition: A response indicating that an individual is comfortable with the amount of preparation by the local government for their community or neighborhood.

PermissibleValues.value: Worried that if they get sick they will not be able to get good medical care
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Worried about Not Getting Good Medical Care if Sick

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Worried about Not Getting Good Medical Care if Sick
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A question about whether an individual is worried that they will not be able to get good medical care if they get sick.

Concepts.longName: Worried about Not Getting Good Medical Care if Sick
Concepts.definition: A response indicating that an individual is worried that they will not be able to get good medical care if they get sick.

PermissibleValues.value: Staying at home more than they are used to

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A question about whether an individual is staying home more than they used to.

Concepts.definition: A response indicating that an individual is staying home more than they used to.

PermissibleValues.value: Worried that COVID-19 will make them unable to pay their bills
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Worried about Being Unable to Pay Bills

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Worried about Being Unable to Pay Bills
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A question about whether an individual is worried that something will make them unable to pay their bills.

Concepts.longName: Worried about Being Unable to Pay Bills
Concepts.definition: A response indicating that an individual is worried that something will make them unable to pay their bills.

PermissibleValues.value: Worried about working at home, taking sick leave, or being asked to take sick leave because of COVID-19
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Worried about Working at Home or Taking or Being Asked to Take Sick Leave

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Worried about Working at Home or Taking or Being Asked to Take Sick Leave
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A question about whether an individual is worried about working at home, taking sick leave, or being asked to take sick leave.

Concepts.longName: Worried about Working at Home or Taking or Being Asked to Take Sick Leave
Concepts.definition: A response indicating that an individual is worried about working at home, taking sick leave, or being asked to take sick leave.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Worried that it will Affect Health

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A question about whether an individual is worried that something will affect their health.

Concepts.definition: A response indicating that an individual is worried that something will affect their health.
